thread.title: Stéphane Séjourné: Palestinians “have the right to a state” - The Limited Times
thread.title_full: Stéphane Séjourné: Palestinians “have the right to a state” - The Limited Times

author: Anonym
title: Stéphane Séjourné: Palestinians “have the right to a state” - The Limited Times
text:
The Palestinians “
have the right to sovereignty and to a state
”, declared the head of French diplomacy Stéphane Séjourné on Saturday, after the Israeli Prime Minister reaffirmed his opposition to “
Palestinian sovereignty
” in Gaza.
“
France will remain faithful to its commitment to achieve this goal
,” continues Stéphane Séjourné on X (formerly twitter).
The French minister's tweet comes after statements by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu opposed to Palestinian sovereignty in Gaza and believing that Israel must retain “
control of the security of the
Palestinian territory”.
Israel must “
ensure that Gaza no longer poses a threat
” and this requirement “
contradicts the demand for Palestinian sovereignty
”, explained Benjamin Netanyahu during a telephone interview on Friday with US President Joe Biden, according to the Prime Minister's Office .
The United States and Europe are pleading in favor of a two-state solution, which is opposed by the Israeli government, engaged in a war against Palestinian Hamas in Gaza, after the bloody October 7 attack carried out by the terrorist movement in Israel.
This unprecedented attack led to the death of 1,140 people, the majority civilians, according to an AFP count.
The Israeli response in Gaza has left nearly 25,000 dead, the vast majority of them women, children and adolescents, according to the Hamas Ministry of Health.
